name: Present Tense Stem Change -ar verbs
description: -ar stem-changing verbs vowel. e changes to ie.

bulletpoints: shoe verb, in all forms except nosostros and vosotros.

sentenceList.english: I have to get it right this time
sentenceList.spanish: Tengo que acertar esta vez.

sentenceList.english: I always get the words right.
sentenceList.spanish: Siempre acierto las palabras.

sentenceList.english: We got it right.
sentenceList.spanish: La acertamos correctamente

sentenceList.english: you are always right.
sentenceList.spanish: Tu aciertas siempre.

sentenceList.english: you hit it right the first time
sentenceList.spanish: acertáis bien la primera vez.

sentenceList.english: Perhaps he is right to say that I am wrong.
sentenceList.spanish: Quizás el acierta al decir que me equivoco.

sentenceList.english: they got it right.
sentenceList.spanish: La aciertan correctamente

sentenceList.english: I governed yesterday sole. Today we govern together.
sentenceList.spanish: Goberné ayer sole. Hoy gobernamos juntos.

sentenceList.english: I govern over the children in my house.
sentenceList.spanish: Yo gobierno sobre los niños en mi casa.

sentenceList.english: We govern the people of Mexico.
sentenceList.spanish: Gobernamos al pueblo de Mexico.

sentenceList.english: You govern your own life
sentenceList.spanish: Tú gobiernas tu propia vida

sentenceList.english: You rule your emotions.
sentenceList.spanish: Gobernáis  tus emociones.

sentenceList.english: She governs her household as mother.
sentenceList.spanish: Ella gobierna su casa como madre.

sentenceList.english: The teachers govern the playground
sentenceList.spanish: Las maestras gobiernan el patio de recreo.
Lo cerré ayer también, pero el perro lo empujó para abrirlo
sentenceList.english: I closed it yesterday also, but the dog pushed it open.

sentenceList.spanish: Mañana cerraré la puerta y la bloquearé.
sentenceList.english: Tommorow I will close the gate and lock it.

sentenceList.spanish: Cierro la puerta todos los días.
sentenceList.english: I close the gate everday.

sentenceList.spanish: Ceramos la puerta todos los días.
sentenceList.english: We close the gate everday.

sentenceList.spanish: Ella piensa en su amiga durante el día.
sentenceList.english: she thinks about her friend during the day.

sentenceList.spanish: yesterday,I thought about my dreams and goals
sentenceList.english: Ayer pensé en mis sueños y metas.

sentenceList.spanish: mañana pensaremos en tus facturas hoy festejaremos.
sentenceList.english: tommorow, we will think about our bills today we will party.

paragraph.english: I think. We think. You think about. She think. They Think.
paragraph.spanish: Pienso. Nosotros pensamos. Tu piensas sobre. Ella piensa. Ellos piensan.

sentenceList.spanish: Empiezo a estudiar español cuando bebo café.
sentenceList.english: I begin to study spanish when I drink cafe.

sentenceList.spanish: ayer empezaron a estudiar español por la noche.
sentenceList.english: yesterday, they began to study spanish at night.
